name: La Cage Aux Folles Trivia Game | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which character sings "A Little More Mascara"?
questions.explanation:
Albin.

	Albin was originally played on Broadway by George Hearn, later star of "Follies", "Wicked" and also appearing in the short-lived "A Doll's Life".

questions.text: Who played the role of Georges in the 2004 Broadway revival, which ran from December 9, 2004 to June 26, 2005?
questions.explanation:
Daniel Davis.

	The role was later taken over by Robert Goulet, star of the original "Camelot"; the production ran from December 3, 1960 to January 5, 1963.  Daniel Davis has also been seen in "Amadeus", which ran from December 17, 1980 to October 16, 1983.

questions.text: Which member of the original Broadway production was also in the original Broadway cast of "Into The Woods"?
questions.explanation:
Merle Louise.

	Merle Louise played the Giant, Cinderella's Mother and the Grandmother in the production, which ran from November 5, 1987 to September 3, 1989. She was born Merle Letowt and made her Broadway debut in 1959.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "With Anne on my Arm" "I'm simply a man who walks on the ___________ whenever it's Anne on my arm!"
questions.explanation:
stars.

	Jean-Michel sings "With Anne on my Arm", a song about his girlfriend Anne. The role was originated on Broadway by John Wiener and was revived in 2004 by Gavin Creel.

questions.text: According to Georges, why does he bounce back quicker than Albin?
questions.explanation:
He's more limber.

	"That's because I'm more limber!" retorts Georges at the start of the song "With You On My Arm", sung by Georges and a reluctant Albin.

questions.text: When the Dindons arrive to meet Jean-Michel's parents, whom does Albin at first masquerade as?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Al.

	"Uncle Al" is secretly Albin trying to act masculine. He later is coerced into performing a song-and-dance routine in front of the Dindons and is eventually discovered.

Jean-Michel.

	Jean-Michel sings this song in Act Two, when the conservative Dindons discover that Albin and Georges are a gay couple. Dindon was originally played by Jay Garner.

questions.text: Who directed the original Broadway production of "La Cage Aux Folles"?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Lauents.

	Arthur Laurents also wrote the book to the musical "West Side Story". He was born in 1918 in New York and was given a Tony Award for directing "La Cage Aux Folles".

questions.text: Jerry Zaks won a Tony Award for directing the 2004 revival of "La Cage Aux Folles".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Zaks, a performer-turned-director who has also directed productions of "Guys and Dolls" and "The Caine Mutiny Court-Martial", was not even nominated for directing the revival.

questions.text: Which cast member of the 2004 revival can be heard on the 2003 cast recording for Sondheim's musical "Bounce"?
questions.explanation:
Gavin Creel.

	Gavin Creel, along with Nathan Lane and Victor Garber, has been one of the many performers connected to Sondheim's collaboration with John Weidman, "Bounce". "Bounce" tells the story of the Mizner brothers as they adventure across America.
